headline: Pro vs. DIY: Which Customer Segment Will Power Lowe's in 2025?
summary: LOW leans on Pro customers with acquisitions and tools to drive bigger projects, while DIY sales face homeowner caution.

headline: How Is Lowe's Stock Performance Compared to Other Consumer Discretionary Stocks?
summary: Lowe's has underperformed the Consumer Discretionary industry over the past year, but analysts are moderately optimistic about the stock’s prospects.

headline: U.S. holiday spending set for steepest drop since pandemic, PwC survey shows
summary: PwC, which polled about 4,000 U.S. consumers between June and July, said shoppers on average plan to spend about $1,552 per person, down 5.3% from last year.  The last comparable decline was in 2020, when average spend fell 7.6% to $1,187.
